intro: Chaetogastra pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and the plant produces small, woody fruits. Chaetogastra pauciflora is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
